Name: Drug
Description: A drug is a chemical substance that has a physiological effect on an organism. Medicinal, herbal, and illegal drugs can be included in this type.

Properties.Name: Active moieties
Properties.Description: The active moiety or moieties of this drug.

Properties.Name: Pharmacological class
Properties.Description: A drug class is a method of identifying and grouping drugs by chemical type, active ingredients, or by medical condition it treats. A drug can belong to more than one drug class.

Properties.Name: Legal status
Properties.Description: The legal status of this drug, as defined by government bodies that regulate therapeutic goods.

Properties.Name: Marketed formulations
Properties.Description: Formulations of this drug that are available in the market. This property includes only drug formulations that uniquely include this drug as an active moiety. Drug formulations that are a combination of this drug with others can be found via the active_moiety_of property.

Properties.Name: Mechanism of action
Properties.Description: The biological or chemical mechanism by which the drug acts in the body. Example, "Corticosteroid hormone receptor agonist"

Properties.Name: Physiologic effect
Properties.Description: The physiological effect of the drug in the body, example: "Decreased platelet production"

Properties.Name: Pregnancy category
Properties.Description: The pregnancy category of a drug is an assessment of the risk of fetal injury due to the drug, when used by the mother during pregnancy.
